page.title: 01Salem and District.
page.content: Salem village forms the focal point of this area. It is agricultural and except for the village, very sparsely populated. The farms are either self- sufficient units of about 100 acres, or smallholdings, run by families whose main income stems from outside the area. The village consists of people connected with agriculture, mainly the original Welsh inhabitants, together with commuters; men who work elsewhere leaving their families in the area. There are therefore two distinct social groups, and these are further divided by the language. The original inhabitants of farms and village speak Welsh;most of the newcomers speak only English. The identity of the area is thus changing from a self- sufficient rural community into a commuter belt district of Llandeilo and beyond.
